食不厭精，膾不厭細.pinyin: shi2 bu4 yan4 jing1 , kuai4 bu4 yan4 xi4
食不厭精，膾不厭細.definition: lit. to eat but finely ground grain and finely chopped meat (idiom, from Analects); fig. to be fastidious about one's food

食不果腹.definition: lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom); fig. poverty-stricken

食不知味.definition: lit. to eat without tasting the food; worried or downhearted (idiom)

食之無味，棄之不甘.pinyin: shi2 zhi1 wu2 wei4 , qi4 zhi1 bu4 gan1
食之無味，棄之不甘.definition: see 食之無味，棄之可惜|食之无味，弃之可惜[shi2 zhi1 wu2 wei4 , qi4 zhi1 ke3 xi1]

食之無味，棄之可惜.pinyin: shi2 zhi1 wu2 wei4 , qi4 zhi1 ke3 xi1
食之無味，棄之可惜.definition: lit. to be hardly worth eating, but it would still be a pity to discard it (idiom); fig. some things have little to no value, yet one is still reluctant to part with them

食人.definition: man-eating (beast); to eat people; fig. to oppress the people

食人鯊.definition: man-eating shark; same as 大白鯊|大白鲨[da4 bai2 sha1], great white shark (Carcharodon carcharias)

食俸.definition: salary of a public official; to be in government service

食古不化.definition: to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom); to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject

食堂.definition: dining hall; cafeteria; CL:個|个[ge4],間|间[jian1]

食客.definition: diner (in a restaurant etc); hanger-on; sponger

食宿.definition: board and lodging; room and board

食指大動.definition: (idiom) to be excited to dig into the delicious food

食火雞.definition: cassowary (genus Casuarius), large flightless bird native to northeastern Australia and New Guinea; CL:隻|只[zhi1]

食物及藥品管理局.pinyin: shi2 wu4 ji2 yao4 pin3 guan3 li3 ju2
食物及藥品管理局.definition: US Food and Drug Administration authority (FDA)

食玉炊桂.definition: food is more precious than jade and firewood more expensive than cassia (idiom); the cost of living is very high

食玩.definition: small toy or figurine included with a food product; DIY candy kit

食祿.definition: to draw government pay; to be in public service; salary of an official

食管.definition: esophagus; gullet; (Tw) regulation of food safety and sanitation (abbr. for 食品衛生管理|食品卫生管理[shi2pin3 wei4sheng1 guan3li3])

食肉寢皮.definition: to eat sb's flesh and sleep on their hide (idiom); to swear revenge on sb; implacable hatred; to have sb's guts for garters

食肉目.definition: Carnivora, order of carnivores within Mammalia

食色.definition: food and sex; appetite and lust

食色性也.definition: Appetite and lust are only natural (Mencius 6A:4).; By nature we desire food and sex.

食荼臥棘.definition: to eat bitter fruit and lie on thorns (idiom); to share the hard life of the common people

食衣住行.definition: see 衣食住行[yi1 shi2 zhu4 xing2]

食補.definition: tonic food (food considered to be particularly healthful); to eat such foods

食言而肥.definition: lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom); fig. not to live up to one's promises

食道.definition: esophagus; gullet; (old) the proper way to eat; (old) food transportation route

食量.definition: quantity of food one eats; food intake
